newsitem.title: USA: Dow moves sharply lower at open, NYSE sets curbs.
newsitem.headline: Dow moves sharply lower at open, NYSE sets curbs.

text.p: Wall Street stocks opened sharply lower Wednesday, prompting the New York Stock Exchange to set index-arbitrage trading curbs at 0940 EDT/1340 GMT.
The Dow industrials shed about 60 points before pulling up to a 39-point decline at 7721. The Nasdaq composite fell about 10 points to 1433.
Analysts said the market was weighed down by earnings warnings from two high-profile computer companies, Gateway 2000 Inc and Seagate Technology Inc.
Both companies warned of lower-than-expected results Tuesday and the stocks are indicated to open sharply lower.
